resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
*Original report*

Nightly builds show this error:

{code:java}
ERROR: Failed building wheel for pygit2
Failed to build pygit2
ERROR: Could not build wheels for pygit2 which use PEP 517 and cannot be installed directly
{code}

This affects Python 3.6 and 3.7, see 

* https://cloud.drone.io/ursacomputing/crossbow/458/1/2
* https://cloud.drone.io/ursacomputing/crossbow/461/1/2

*Update*

This is still affecting the nightly build (2021-04-20)
Python 3.6 https://cloud.drone.io/ursacomputing/crossbow/500/1/2
Python 3.7 https://cloud.drone.io/ursacomputing/crossbow/501/1/2
Python 3.8 https://cloud.drone.io/ursacomputing/crossbow/499/1/2
Python 3.9 https://cloud.drone.io/ursacomputing/crossbow/498/1/2

_This affect just ARM64._
fields.summary: [CI] [Python] ERROR: Failed building wheel for pygit2 on ARM64

comments.body:
it is important to mention that this affects just ARM64, in the last two days, see 

- conda-linux-gcc-py36-arm64:
  URL: https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/branches/all?query=nightly-2021-04-22-0-drone-conda-linux-gcc-py36-arm64

- conda-linux-gcc-py37-arm64:
  URL: https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/branches/all?query=nightly-2021-04-22-0-drone-conda-linux-gcc-py37-arm64

- conda-linux-gcc-py38-arm64:
  URL: https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/branches/all?query=nightly-2021-04-22-0-drone-conda-linux-gcc-py38-arm64

- conda-linux-gcc-py39-arm64:
  URL: https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/branches/all?query=nightly-2021-04-22-0-drone-conda-linux-gcc-py39-arm64
pygit2 doesn't ship wheels for arm64 architecture, so we should install the crossbow dependencies using conda instead
Why is pygit2 needed at all to build conda packages?
